bill_title: require the Department of Corrections penal institutions to be accredited by the American Correctional Association.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Department of Corrections penal institutions to be accredited by the American Correctional Association. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any penal institution under the direction of the Governor shall be accredited by the American Correctional Association. The accreditation shall address services, programs, and operations essential to good correctional management, including administrative and fiscal controls, staff training and development, physical plant, safety and emergency procedures, sanitation, food services, and rules and discipline. Section 2. The Department of Corrections shall enter into a contractual agreement with the American Correctional Association by July 31, 2000, and shall report the status of the accreditation to the Seventy-Sixth Legislature. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
